instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3115 trolls or i am an idiot?
threads.message:
came with a blown DCIN fuse which is already a joke to see. Also short circuit on mains on the MagSafe board. After Fuse/Charging board replacement i got a fan spin and full choo-choo with a new battery.
On my bench. After full assembly, i put it on outcome desk and plugged in an original known-good Magsafe 60w charger which is perfectly compatible with 2012 mid 13' A1278. No light, no charge, DCIN cycles on the charger (did not know board can do that, but okay though). Works with a 45w china crap-charger works with my bench cable which is probably also a crap cable.


SOLUTION:
thanks to 2informaticos: Q7080 reverse current protection circuit MosFeT: short-circuit between drain and gate. The original power brick is smart enough to cut down the power, bench PSU gives zero shits about reverse current.

threads.title: 820-3115 trolls or i am an idiot?
threads.message: Get a KNOWN GOOD 85 watt magsafe for testing no need for any other wattage.

threads.title: 820-3115 trolls or i am an idiot?
threads.message:
It should start with 60W charger, original, or not.
Post values (ohm scale) for R7080/81 and R7085/86, measured onboard.
Usually bad Q7080...

threads.title: 820-3115 trolls or i am an idiot?
threads.message:
jup, that was bad Q7080 semi-short between drain and gate. It was generally my laziness, i check gate-drain and call it OK. 
Thank you for the sollution!
